intro: Linaria striata var. multiflora, commonly known as the variable toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange to red-orange flowers. The leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive, somewhat fuzzy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
